The principal goal of the Access Coordination and Monitoring Support to Gaza project is to facilitate and account for the entry materials used for UNDP/PAPP projects in Gaza in support of the recovery and reconstruction process.

description.narrative: Access Coordination and Monitoring of Access of materials in Gaza.

- Projects in number and money Value that were supported by Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Project - Coordinated and Facilitate access of materials into Gaza (truck-load) - Secure COGAT approval for dual-use materials into Gaza for UNDP projects - Accountability towards imported materials and ensure proper end use of these materials - Quality control of coordinated material

comment.narrative: 10 Projects in number 30% of UNDP Portfolio 5 Approvals Zero Monitoring Zero Quality Control

Conduct the necessary coordination of dual-use materials for all UNDP construction projects, while performing the necessary monitoring to assure the appropriate end use, and maintaining necessary quality control. Communication and Coordination with Israeli Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) and it division Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA) to obtain necessary approvals in timely fashion manner.

In year 2015 Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Project has coordinated for a total of 36,813.95 Tons of dual-use construction materials (or the load of 943Trucks).
These coordinated materials supported the completion of 18 projects with value of US$ 14.07 Million in year 2015. The status of all UNDP projects by 31 December 2015 is:
Description Total Value(USD) Number of projects On-going Projects 11,903,970 23 Project in Design/Tendering Stage 79,693,960 4 Completed Projects 32,697,392 83 Total 124,295,322 110

Conduct the necessary coordination of dual-use materials for all UNDP construction projects, while performing the necessary monitoring to assure the appropriate end use, and maintaining necessary quality control. Communication and Coordination with Israeli Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) and it division Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA) to obtain necessary approvals in timely fashion manner.

In year 2016 Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Project has coordinated for a total of 9,092.29 Tons of dual-use construction materials (or the load of 295 Trucks).
In year 2016, UNDP/PAPP Gaza Office delivered a total of US$ 82 Million of projects and activities. Out of this total, the Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Project (ACMSP) facilitated the coordination of materials for 26 projects that were completed in year 2016, with a value of US$ 65.7 Million, which represents 80% of the UNDP/PAPP Gaza delivery.
Out of the total delivery of UNDP/PAPP Gaza in year 2016, the Infrastructure Unit has delivered alone US$ 53 Million value of projects, and ACMSP facilitated the necessary coordination of materials for 21 infrastructure projects, that completed in year 2016, with value of US$ 45 Million (which represents 85% of Infrastructure total delivery for year 2016). As well, the ACMSP supported other UNDP/PAPP units and facilitated the needed coordinations for projects that were completed in year 2016, with a value of US$ 20.4 Million, which represents 71% of total delivery of these units for year 2016. In addition, the ACMSP has contributed to the completion of five non-UN projects for St. John Hospital, Al Azhar University, Latin Patriarchate and Mercy Corps, with a total value of US$ 3.06 Million in year 2016.
The following table summarizes the projects, which were completed in year 2016 (in numbers and values), by the contribution of Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Project. Description Number of Projects Value of Projects US$ -Completed Projects for UNDP/PAPP Gaza Infrastructure Unit 21 $45,240,478 -Completed Projects for other UNDP/PAPP Gaza Units 5

Conduct the necessary coordination of dual-use materials for all UNDP construction projects, while performing the necessary monitoring to assure the appropriate end use, and maintaining necessary quality control. Communication and Coordination with Israeli Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) and it division Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA) to obtain necessary approvals in timely fashion manner.

Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Team (ACMST) is working on achieving its goals by operating the access of materials efficiently and effectively, while maintaining quality control and timely delivery of scheduled approved materials. The ACMST is conducting extensive coordination with all partners involved, including a) the Israeli Authorities at various levels: COGAT and Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA), b) the Palestinian Government c) Gaza local authorities, d) UN and other international partners, e) Contractors and contractors Union
The ACMST is conducting close monitoring of entry, checking, and transportation -including escorting- storing and handling of materials, from their arrival at border crossings to their final usage. And produce reporting on usage of materials and progress of work.

As well, the ACMSP supported other UNDP/PAPP units and facilitated the needed coordinations for projects that were completed in year 2016, with a value of US$ 20.4 Million, which represents 71% of total delivery of these units for year 2016.
In addition, the ACMSP has contributed to the completion of five non-UN projects for St. John Hospital, Al Azhar University, Latin Patriarchate and Mercy Corps, with a total value of US$ 3.06 Million in year 2016.
The following table summarizes the projects, which were completed in year 2016 (in numbers and values), by the contribution of Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Project.
Description Number of Projects Value of Projects US$ -Completed Projects for UNDP/PAPP Gaza Infrastructure Unit 21 $45,240,478 -Completed Projects for other UNDP/PAPP Gaza Units 5

Conduct the necessary coordination of dual-use materials for all UNDP construction projects, while performing the necessary monitoring to assure the appropriate end use, and maintaining necessary quality control. Communication and Coordination with Israeli Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT) and it division Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA) to obtain necessary approvals in timely fashion manner.

Access Coordination and Monitoring Support Team (ACMST) is working on achieving its goals by operating the access of materials efficiently and effectively, while maintaining quality control and timely delivery of scheduled approved materials. The ACMST is conducting extensive coordination with all partners involved, including a) the Israeli Authorities at various levels: COGAT and Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA), b) the Palestinian Government c) Gaza local authorities, d) UN and other international partners, e) Contractors and contractors Union
The ACMST is conducting close monitoring of entry, checking, and transportation -including escorting- storing and handling of materials, from their arrival at border crossings to their final usage. And produce reporting on usage of materials and progress of work.

This project aims to promote knowledge and awareness in Human Development in oPt. It is part of a multi-phased programme designed for advocacy in oPt as per UNDP's contribution to setting the development agenda and supporting development debate.

The NHDR project will be implemented in three tracks. It involves the preparation of the NHDR itself, cover the carrying out of the quarterly surveys on perceptions and the production of Human Development materials and programme development support.

title.narrative: Palestinian National Unity and Social Cohesion Programme

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen Palestinian National Unity by addressing issues pertaining to national reconciliation, civil service reintegration, improving local capacities and planning schemes, as well as the social cohesion of Palestinian society.

title.narrative: Project document for National Unity and Social Cohesion
Annual workplan for national unity project 2014 2015

description.narrative: The project aims at anchoring national unity and social cohesion throughout the Palestinian society through support to consolidated governance mechanisms, social reconciliation, enhanced civic engagement.

comment.narrative: 1. Some 4,600 civil servants in the health and education sector hired pre-June 2007 (app. 30%) receive a salary but have not been reintegrated, while some 8,900 civil health and education personnel hired after June 2007 by the then de facto authority are attending work, but are not receiving a regular salary. 2. Absence of a coordination mechanism federating reconciliation initiatives. 3. Absence of a monitoring mechanism for implementation of reconciliation agreements; 4. Absence of a recovery strategy for the Gaza Strip.

1. Potential cost paper on civil service integration shared with Prime Ministers office 2. An action plan clarifying sequence of reintegration process was shared with the Prime Ministers office 3. Through various networks, including Sector working group on Public Administration, discussions transpired on supporting the process of reintegration 4. A mapping of CSO initiatives related to reconciliation was completed. Outcome showed very little efforts taking place on the ground. 5. A number of events took place promoting national unity took place in the West Bank and Gaza. 6. Social cohesion measurement tool attempted, but not completed. 7. Conference organized by Bir Zeit University and Palthink in the West Bank to develop a CSO network to promote reconciliation was conducted. 8. Gaza Area based recovery strategy and action plan completed.

1. Conference promoting Civil Society Networking planned for Gaza. 2. Local Economic Development (LED) Units Established 3. Led Specialist Hired. 4. 2009 Local Governance Diagnostic to be updated. 5. Synergized LED system to be developed. 6. GPC Strategy for Civil Servants to be drafted 7. Economic Mapping of five Gaza Municipalities

1. Conference held in Gaza with over 25 CSO's to discuss developing a network to advocate for reconciliation. 2. Five Local Economic Development Units in Rafah, Khan Younis, Nusseirat, Deir Balah, and Beit Lahia Municipalites of the Gaza Strip established. UNDP purchased necessary equipment and furniture to initiate the unit. 3. Five LED specialist recruited to work in the units. 4. A Local Governance Diagnostic report, the first since 2009, was drafted. 5. A draft Integrated National LED Framework was written and shared with the Ministry of Local Government. 6. A General Personnel Council (GPC) Civil Service Strategic plan for 2017 - 2022 drafted 7. Economic Mapping of Five Gaza Municipalities was initiated.

1. Economic Mapping to be completed of Five Gaza Municipalities. 2. Hold at least four events pertaining to Local Governance and Development (LED Framework, LED Conference, Local Diagnostic report, Economic mapping) 3. Conduct at least two activities fostering reconciliation with either Youth, Women, CSO's, and other marginalized groups.. 4. Hold at least one Public Administration related event. 5. Strategic Plan for Civil Servants is completed and launched. 6. Hold at Least 5 LED Forums.
